llm_recommendations.reason_for_recommendation: MoUs with Holtec International and Clean Core Thorium Energy expected to gain momentum with passage of SHANTI Act, opening up US nuclear market opportunities and design/build solutions for SMR projects.
llm_recommendations.timeframe: next three to six months for clarity on progress

llm_recommendations.reason_for_recommendation: Secured a 248.85 MW wind energy order from ArcelorMittal Group, strengthening its position as the largest wind energy player in Gujarat and contributing to green steel capacity. Focus on EPC segment expected to drive order wins.

Through its renewable energy arm, placed a 248.85 MW wind energy order for captive consumption, reflecting increasing industry commitment to cleaner production and sustainability goals for steel manufacturing.

Plans to exit Phase-I of the Hyderabad Metro project by FY26 to streamline its infrastructure portfolio; discussions progressing with the Government of Telangana for divestment. Q3 revenue boosted by fare hike despite ridership decline.
Cyberattack crippled operations, leading to factories stopping activity for nearly six weeks in 2025, contributing to Britain's car manufacturing slump to a 70-year low.
Shuttering its Vauxhall van plant in Luton, contributing to a 16% decline in total UK commercial vehicle manufacturing.
Production is predicted to pick up by more than 10% this year due to the introduction of new battery-powered models such as its latest Leaf.

llm_recommendations.reason_for_recommendation: In talks to invest less than $10 billion in OpenAI, reinforcing its longstanding backing and exclusive rights to sell OpenAI models to cloud customers.
In talks to invest significantly more than $10 billion, potentially even more than $20 billion, in OpenAI as a new investor, expanding its strategic involvement in AI.

Optimistic outlook on capital market growth as regulatory tightening for broking industry is believed to be easing; strong performance in asset management and private equity businesses, including closing a $1 billion private equity fund, and plans to seed new verticals like private credit.
llm_recommendations.timeframe: March quarter expected to see broking growth again
